name: 24/7 Moondust Glittery Eyeshadow
about: What it is: Wet slurry eyeshadow formula with high-shine finish & silky texture. Micro-fine glitter for a wet-look effect & supercharged sparkle up to 16 hours...Ingredient Callouts: It is vegan and cruelty-free...What Else You Need to Know: This glittery eyeshadow single gives you maximum sparkle, buildable intensity, and a long-lasting wet-look finish that feels smooth. The velvety vegan eyeshadow formula can be applied with a finger or blended with a brush for a diffused glow and radiant eye look.
ingredients: Dimethicone, Talc, Calcium Sodium Borosilicate, Isododecane, Triisostearyl Citrate, Ci 77891/Titanium Dioxide, Ci 77492/Iron Oxides, Cetyl Dimethicone, Phenoxyethanol, Ci 77491/Iron Oxides, Caprylyl Glycol, Ci 77742/Manganese Violet, Ci 77499/Iron Oxides, Tin Oxide, Caffeine.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-First, prime lids with Eyeshadow Primer Potion (sold separately) for more vibrant, crease-free color that lasts all day. .-For even bolder, richer color, use a corresponding 24/7 Glide-On Eyeliner Pencil (sold separately) as an all-over base. .-Apply all over lid for a blended look or create a more dramatic graphic look using the tip of the Shadow Stick (sold separately) to create thin to thick lines. .-Blend within 15 to 30 seconds of applying with any UD Pro Eyeshadow Brush (sold separately) or fingers; be aware that it dries quickly..-Use the built-in sharpener to create thinner lines for a more precise application. .-Finally, lock down your makeup look for up to 16 hours with All Nighter Long-Lasting Makeup Setting Spray (sold separately).

reviews.review_title: Nowhere near as good as the original formula
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I got all three new shades (Wild Dipper, Rebel Star, and Cosmic Craze) and two of them were utterly disappointing.   Wild Dipper felt chunky flakey and there was somehow fallout when swatching. I don't know if it's because this shade has more of a pigment base but whatever the reason it's nowhere near as good as the formula of Space Cowboy. Plus the glitter was a little big compared to SC and didn't have the wet looking sparkle I was hoping for. I returned this.  Cosmic Craze was a joke. The base pigment was patchy and streaky and the glitters were gritty I could literally feel them when swatching. I didn't even bother putting this on the eyes and immediately returned it. Definitely not worth your money.  Rebel Star was the most decent out of the three. Again, in comparison to SC the glitter was not as refined but it's still pretty good but it's such a minute difference, if you haven't ever tried the moondust shadows you wouldn't notice a difference. It's similar in shade to SC but with more base pigment and practically identical sparkle.   Out of the three new shades, Rebel Star is the only one worth getting. That or the OG shades (Space Cowboy, Cosmic, etc.). I recommend the product just not the new shades.

reviews.review_text: I recently purchased the moon dust shadow in space cowboy, and I must say, it has added a touch of magic and glamour to my makeup looks. The sparkles in this eye shadow truly make my eyes pop and create a mesmerizing effect that catches the light beautifully. The sparkles are vibrant and reflective, instantly adding a dazzling touch to any eye look. Whether I'm going for a subtle shimmer or a bold, glittery statement, this eye shadow delivers on both fronts. The color payoff is impressive, and a little goes a long way, ensuring that the product lasts for a considerable amount of time. The texture of the eye shadow is smooth and velvety, making it easy to apply and blend. I appreciate that this product doesn't leave me with a trail of sparkles all over my face, but rather keeps them in place on my eyelids. If you're looking to add a touch of magic and sparkle to your makeup routine, I highly recommend giving this eye shadow a try!

reviews.review_text: I've been an avid URBAN DECAY fan since I was a kid and this moondust shadow doesn't dissapoint. I normally dont like to buy singles becauseci love palettes but the moondust collection has a beautiful array of high glitter shadows. Space cowboy is a warm tan pink color with silver glitter specks throughout. I like to wear it with warm colors on my brow bone or the inner eye corner to make a look pop. The color is easy to blend and definitely a great neutral color thats easy to add to any look. I'm really happy with this ! Thanks bzzagent for letting me try this amazing sample!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Urban Decay's Moondust Eyeshadow in Space Cowboy is a galaxy of sparkles on my eyelids. I initially applied some on my bare eyelids with a brush, but felt the effect wasn't as noticeable. I applied some with my finger and felt I got much better results. The eyeshadow felt very creamy, soft, and luxurious. With my skin tone, I felt that Space Cowboy was translucent and only glitter showed up. I decided to overlay it on top of my normal, neutral everyday eyeshadow and it seemed to match well. However, it was still just a canvas of glitter/sparkles. It was long lasting and withstood a long day of wear, but taking it off was a bit of a pain. I kept finding sparkles all over my cheeks/eyelids. This would be perfect for special occasions or even casual wear when you want a splash of excitement. Even though it claims to have caffeine to give more energy to your eye, not sure it actually made a difference or was just a placebo effect for me. But I did feel like the sparkles made my eyes pop. I think this shade is perfect and matches all skin tones. I did notice that it doesn't show up as well in photos/videos. It's one of those products that looks better in person. I definitely enjoy recommend it.

reviews.review_text: I loved this shadow. It is very difficult to explain how it actually looks in person. The camera doesn't capture at all the way it catches the light in real life. reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Oily skin
